text.section:
A company action level event occurs:
when an insurer files an RBC report that indicates that:
the insurer has total adjusted capital that is:
in the case of a life insurer, the life insurer has total adjusted capital that:
in the case of a property and casualty insurer, the property and casualty insurer has total adjusted capital that:
in the case of a health insurer, the health insurer has total adjusted capital that:
when the Commissioner notifies an insurer of an adjusted RBC report that indicates an event under item (1) of this subsection; or
if an insurer requests a hearing to challenge an adjusted RBC report that indicates an event under item (1) of this subsection, when the Commissioner notifies the insurer that the Commissioner, after a hearing, has rejected the insurer's challenge.

The insurer shall submit the RBC plan to the Commissioner:
within 45 days after the date of the company action level event; or
if the insurer requests a hearing to challenge an adjusted RBC report, within 45 days after notification to the insurer that the Commissioner, after a hearing, has rejected the insurer's challenge.

section.section: Within 60 days after an insurer submits an RBC plan to the Commissioner, the Commissioner shall notify the insurer whether the Commissioner has determined that the RBC plan may be implemented or that the RBC plan is unsatisfactory.

If the Commissioner determines that the RBC plan is unsatisfactory, the notification to the insurer:
shall set forth the reasons for the determination; and
may set forth proposed revisions that will make the RBC plan satisfactory to the Commissioner.

On notification that the RBC plan is unsatisfactory, the insurer shall:
prepare a revised RBC plan, which may incorporate by reference any revisions proposed by the Commissioner; and
submit the revised RBC plan to the Commissioner.

The insurer shall submit the revised RBC plan required by paragraph (3) of this subsection to the Commissioner:
within 45 days after the notification from the Commissioner; or
if the insurer requests a hearing to challenge the notification from the Commissioner, within 45 days after notification to the insurer that the Commissioner, after a hearing, has rejected the insurer's challenge.

text.section: Subject to the right of the insurer to a hearing, when the Commissioner notifies an insurer that the insurer's RBC plan or revised RBC plan is unsatisfactory, the Commissioner may specify in the notification that the notification constitutes a regulatory action level event.

section.section:
Each domestic insurer that files an RBC plan or revised RBC plan with the Commissioner shall file a copy of the RBC plan or revised RBC plan with the insurance commissioner of any state in which the insurer is authorized to do business if:
the state has a confidentiality provision substantially similar to § 4-310(a) of this subtitle; and
the insurance commissioner of that state has notified the insurer in writing of its request for the filing.

On request of an insurance commissioner of another state under this subsection, the insurer shall file a copy of the RBC plan or revised RBC plan with that insurance commissioner by the later of:
15 days after receipt of the notification to file a copy of its RBC plan or revised RBC plan with that state; or
the date on which the RBC plan or revised RBC plan is filed under subsection (c) or (d) of this section.
